lab: RakshaVahan: On-Vehicle Threat Detection and Sensor Fusion
introduction: Welcome to the RakshaVahan Virtual Laboratory for On-Vehicle Threat Detection and Sensor Fusion. This lab demonstrates end-to-end electronics, sensing, and advanced sensor-fusion techniques for real-time threat detection in moving vehicles using radar, camera, and LiDAR modalities. The virtual lab combines simulation-based learning with real defense technology principles. Students will explore signal processing, multi-sensor fusion algorithms, embedded system design, and threat assessment techniques through interactive experiments.

experiments.name: Power Supply and Protection for On-Vehicle Electronics
Radar Sensor Interface and Signal Processing
Camera Sensing and AI-Based Trigger Generation
Multi-Sensor Fusion and Threat Score Computation
Embedded Controller State Machine for Threat Handling

objective: To provide a comprehensive virtual laboratory environment for understanding multi-sensor fusion, real-time signal processing, and embedded system design for on-vehicle threat detection. Through interactive simulations and experiments, students will gain hands-on experience with radar signal processing, camera-based threat recognition, LiDAR range measurements, sensor fusion algorithms, CAN bus communication, and embedded state machine design. The laboratory bridges the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical implementation of defense-grade threat detection systems.

courseAlignment.description: This lab aligns with advanced signal processing, embedded systems, and automotive electronics courses in leading Indian universities and focuses on skills needed for defense sector and autonomous vehicle development.

pre-requisites: Basic Electronics (diodes, transistors, operational amplifiers), Digital Signal Processing fundamentals, Microcontroller programming basics, MATLAB/Simulink familiarity, Introduction to CAN bus and communication protocols, Basic understanding of radar, camera, and LiDAR principles.
